action: I want to submit applications such as expenses and contracts according to official approval flows and visualize the approval status
reason: To proceed with business while observing internal controls and to prevent missed approvals or fraudulent processing
acceptance_criteria: Application creation is only executable by authenticated users.
Application creation authority is controlled based on roles.
Application IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
Selecting an application type (e.g., expenses, contracts, equipment purchase, etc.) is mandatory.
The application title is a mandatory input.
Application content must be within 1,000 characters.
Numeric format checks are performed for applications requiring monetary input.
Attachment files can be uploaded.
Only attachment files that have passed a virus scan are stored.
Files with dangerous extensions are rejected.
A maximum file size limit is set.
Input data is sanitized (Anti-XSS).
DB access uses parameterized queries (Anti-SQL Injection).
A workflow is automatically generated upon submission.
The approval route (approver sequence) is configurable from the management screen.
Automated routing to a proxy approver occurs if the primary approver is absent.
Each approval step has statuses for 'Approved', 'Returned (Remand)', and 'Rejected'.
Approval operations are only possible for authorized users.
Comment entry is possible during approval.
A reason for return is mandatory when remanding an application.
A reason for rejection is mandatory when rejecting an application.
Approval operations are saved in the audit log.
Audit logs include application ID, operating user ID, operation details, and timestamp.
The application only enters a 'Completed' state upon final approval.
A notification is sent to the applicant when an application is returned.
A notification is sent to the applicant upon approval completion.
Notifications are processed via asynchronous queues.
Approval status is reflected on the screen in real-time.
Concurrent approval operations trigger conflict detection via optimistic locking.
Approval processing fails if there is a version mismatch.
A change history of the application content is maintained.
Change history stores values from before and after the change.
Applications can be logically deleted.
Deletion is only possible by the Administrator role.
Approved applications cannot be deleted.
The same validation applies to operations via API.
Internal DB information is not included in the response.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
The target response time for the approval API is within 500ms.
